citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
**During a review of facility records it was noted in Protocol 2023-1224 the principal investigator did not include an
appropriate justification for the number of animals to be utilized on the study. The protocol indicated the number of
animals will be collected and used for training based on student participation, however, did not describe the methods used
to determine the number of animals needed during the study. The principal investigator should provide an appropriate
justification for the number of animals that will be required during the study. It is the responsibility of the IACUC to ensure
that proposed activities involving the use of animals have been reviewed and determined to be in accordance with the
Animal Welfare Act unless an appropriate justification for departure from the standards have been documented.
Correct by: August 20, 2024
No animals on the premises at the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
